understanding.p: A topic-set is a collection of related topics. A topic-set is appears in the HTML output as a folder in the table of contents or a chapter in a print document. Typically, a topic-set belongs to a doc-set. Each topic-set contains topics that follow the same schema and typically have related content. A topic-set can use the same schema as other topic-sets. Each topic-set has a configuration file that contains the elements required to build the associated topics. The element /spfe/topic-set-id distinguishs the topic-set from other topic-sets. The element /spfe/topic-set-type determines its position in the table of contents. Note that individual topics in the topic-set are presented in alphabetical order.

planning-question.planning-question-title: When do I neeed to create a new topic-set?

planning-question-body.p: If you add new topics or want to change the order of topics in the table of contents, you may want to create a new topic-set.

how-to-answer-body.p: If you want to do any of the following, you need a new topic-set:

li.p: you want to group new or existing topics under a different folder or chapter in the TOC
you want a group of topics to appear in a different order in the TOC
